SEARCH
Package UI

Class DashboardUI

java.lang.Object
UI.BaseUI
UI.DashboardUI
public class DashboardUI extends BaseUI
This class represents the user interface for the dashboard. It provides functionality for logging in, logging out, and creating a new account.

    • DashboardUI

  • Method Details

    • handleLogin

      private void handleLogin()
      Handles the login action when the login button is clicked. If the user is already logged in, shows a message indicating so. Otherwise, attempts to authenticate the user using the entered credentials.

    • handleLogout

      private void handleLogout()
      Handles the logout action when the logout button is clicked. Sets the isLoggedIn flag to false and shows a logout message.

    • handleCreateAccountButtonClick

      private void handleCreateAccountButtonClick()
      Handles the action when the create account button is clicked. If the user is logged in, shows the create account form. Otherwise, shows a message indicating that login is required.

    • showCreateAccountForm

      private void showCreateAccountForm()
      Displays the create account form. Clears the main content and sets it to the create account form.

    • handleCreateAccount

      private void handleCreateAccount()
      Handles the account creation process when the create button is clicked. Validates the entered username and password, and shows appropriate messages.

    • showLoginForm

      private void showLoginForm()
      Displays the login form. Clears the main content and sets it to the login form.

    • showLoggedInView

      private void showLoggedInView()
      Displays the view for a logged-in user. Clears the main content and sets it to the logged-in view.

    • handleButtonAction

      Description copied from class: BaseUI
      Handles the action when a button is clicked.
      Overrides:
      handleButtonAction in class BaseUI
      Parameters:
      label - The label of the button that was clicked.

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(String title, String content)
      Shows an alert dialog with the given title and content.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the alert.
      content - The content of the alert.

    • preloadUIClasses

      private void preloadUIClasses()
      Preloads UI classes in separate threads to improve application responsiveness.
